Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Gergely T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I read a few bad reviews about the hotel, but I guess people just have unreasonable expectations sometimes. I had a good time, friendly staff, the double room is nice for the money. A high end dutch style low budget hotel to describe it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: evgi13
Reviews.Content: I felt sick when I walked in the room and said.... U must be jocking me.....!!!!!!!!!!! I did not have a very hight expectations, but THAT.... I didnt even want to sleep in that bed, dirty and smelly, everything was broken and old as ...., curtains never been washed or changed. I felt like i was in squat. For that price you can have something better. The night before we left we went out and I left some pouds on the table, when we came back it was gone, so be carefull if you stay there. In the morning polish nationality receptionist been on the phone for an hour in the breakfast area talking polish loud and laughing, had to ask him to put the TV on cos, could not listen to that anymore, milk an eggs was finished, but he didnt even bother to refill..oh yeah he was busy on the phone...disgrace .Yeah ok very central...

Reviews.Title: “perfectly Honest hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: 5 of us stayed here in this hotel for 2 nights and after seeing the reviews on the internet we turned up with the worst impression of what it was going to be like but when we arrived it was clean and staff were friendly enough and when we made it to our room up some very (VERY) steep stairs we were greeted with 2 double and a single (bed) which was exactly what we wanted. the room was a bit grubby were water has discoloured the white walls but the buildings are very old. the bathroom was a joke to try and get changed in as it was so small but again it worked none the less. we had no problems at all the breakfast was very nice and the tea/coffee was good and they had very nice cakes down there at breakfast. only comment was that we we're woken by the cleaner in the hallway with her hoover at 7.30 in the morning~!! very close to city centre but far enough away not to hear the noise. overall if you would like a cheep hotel and your not bothered about being pampered then this is the place for you you can come and go as you please and its cheap and has all the essentials you need! I stayed in hotel room 315 and this review was based on that. please go to this hotel with an opened mind and you will be pleasantly surprised at what you will find. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “not the best but great location”
Reviews.Author: travelista_12
Reviews.Content: The only good point of this Hotel is.....great location - super close to Dam Square. But unfortunately it is a super budget hotel that had its hay-day a while back- certainly not when i went- Breakfast of partly frozen bread, cheese and jam portions- bought in brioche - nescafe style coffee. Room had view on building wall and wasn't the cleanest- Loved the light in the shower (literally next to shower head), picture of room wasn't anything like we saw in the advert. Saying all of this though you pay for what you get but it would classify in my mind a 1 star only. And that is for location only . I went there May 2009 but there was no option to put on there

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be condemed”
Reviews.Author: johnschoManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ajax hotel inSeptember 2011. It is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in and I,ve Been to a lot. Filthy bed linen, a room that looked out two feet to a solid wall of the next building, every thing in the room was broken, the telivision,the bed side lights, the pictures hung on fuse wire, please take my advice and do not stay there it was an experience that I advise you not to do. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.

Reviews.Title: “Mice in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: charliechan12355
Reviews.Content: This place is disgusting it will depress you and ruin your holiday.the young lad at reception was an ignorant, stupid tâ‚¬at. There was a brick wall 2 foot from our window no natural light.there were mice in the room when I complained I was told the guy coming in at 10pm would kill them.needless to say i demanded another room, they were not keen to move us but eventually did.don't go there folks, go outside the city center and get better for your money.this place should be condemned.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the website”
Reviews.Author: teuchter36
Reviews.Content: This is the most appalling hotel in the world. We were booked for 3 nights and left after one. We are now in a fight to get some of our money back. Every bad thing said in the other reviews applies to our stay. I have never seen dirt like that in my life! Avoid room 321 like the plague unless you actually want to catch the plague. We will not let up in our efforts to get our money back and have made a complaint to Netherlands Tourist Board about the Ajax being listed on their IAmsterdam site. By the way, the breakfast was rubbish, those cornflakes were damp enough to have come from the canal. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and we cannot fault the assistance we received from the Tourist Office at Central Station as they located new accommodation for us and advised us how to make a complaint. Angry! Angry! Angry!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what the web site stated”
Reviews.Author: Hawthorne21
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a very good location, the staff are friendly, and the breakfast substantial, the rooms looked very good on the internet, but not what it seemed. It states there is a Safe in the room, yes there is, but it cost us 20euro to hire and would not take a credit card, had to be cash, also it stated that a hair dryer was also in the room, wrong again to have the hair dryer it was 10euro deposit. The room itself was dingy and dark with only one bedside lamp working, very little room for hanging clothes infact I think the En-Suite was probably where the wardrobe was once.The En-suite looked good again in the pictures on the net, infact the shower was so small you could just about turn around, when getting out of the shower the handbasin was in the way,no room at all,when opening the door to go into the en-suite it smelled of damp, no ventilation to let out the smell. To get into the Hotel you have to climb a steepset of stairs with not very nice carpet, infact it needs a lot of tlc, after paying almost Â£100 a night I expected better, will we return I don't think so. How it got a 2* rating I don't know?.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad back in the days”
Reviews.Author: LOLANetherlands
Reviews.Content: We visited the ajax hotel during the summer of 2006 ,it was scorching hot and all the other hotels seemed to be booked. It was very expensive (we paid over 300 euros for 3 nights) but the location is perfect.The rooms were small and functionnal but clean and everything was working back then.Steep stairs to go up if you have mobility problems or huge cases.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly I wouldnt want to send my worst ememies here”
Reviews.Author: little_tortillaUk
Reviews.Content: Okay, lets start with positives.Location is great. Everything is in walking distance. Apart from that, the rooms were terrible. Now I've stayed in Hostels in South America that were nicer than this. Seriously. I would go there again. Here? No chance. The rooms were small, the staff were rude and that tourist tax? I thought we were getting ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: gehry
Reviews.Content: I was stayed in this hotel last november and it was 3 nights. Its quiet good looking simple decorated hotel which located at the heart of city centre. 20 mins walk by Amsterdam Central and 10 mins walk by Red Light District. Prices including breakfast but exclude city tax(actually I have no idea about this tax but whatever, its a less fee). Staff is very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hz265
Reviews.Content: An extremely terrible place to stay for the following reasons: - receptionists/owners are very very unfriendly. They not only asked for full payment before checking in (guess it's because they are afraid customers will immediately run away if they get to see the rooms first), but are very very unhelpful and impatient. -cleanliness/hygiene problems bothered me a lot. The pillows are yellow with stains; the bedsheets are dirty; the rooms smell awful. The worst is that the towels they provide are full of black patches. My friends saw the housekeeping lady putting all the wet towels on floor, totally ignore the fact that loads of people living on the 3rd floor step on them when they walk pass. -the rooms are not sound proof at all. I lived on the first floor and could hear the receptionist sneezing very clearly. You can imagine how we couldn't sleep because people in the next room were talking, laughing and drying their hairs. In conclusion, if you don't want to ruin your holiday, choose another hotel! Don't get cheated just as we did!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Typical budget city hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: AdrianW31
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent position on the Rokin. This puts it close to Rembrandt Plaza and Red light district, without being right in the noisy areas. There are cafes, coffee shops and bars within 50 yards and Rembrandt Plaza is only 800 yards away. Lots of trams stop outside, which makes it easy to get to museums, central station and other places if you don't like walking. The hotel is on first floor and steps are steep, but it has 24 hour reception and a very nice breakfast room where you can also sit in the day, overlooking the canal. Most rooms don't have a view. Breakfast was your normal continental affair but well presented, with lots of coffee available. They have evidently learnt from past experience as food was well covered up and moved. Rooms are what you expect for a budget city hotel, reasonably large and quite comfortable with a very crowded bathroom. Beds were very good although sheets were a bit strange at first. The quality of workmanship was poor, with holes and wonky sockets, but it doesn't affect the room really. Only real downsides were lack of extra pillows that made sitting on bed difficult, and erratic heating. TV is very small and high so you would need to lie down to watch it, not that we did. Staff were friendly and helpful overall, and for the price - 85 Euro - it was reasonable value. Most of your reviewers seem to have never stayed in cheap city hotels and this is typical of the breed. But the position makes up for everything really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but was a little disappointed..”
Reviews.Author: Kara_2323
Reviews.Content: First time in Amsterdam with my boyfriend and we stayed for 5 days, I paid in total for this Â£389 + 5% visitors VAT and I think I was quite overcharged for what we got. Room was extremely small and toliet so small we were sitting on it sideways to use it adequately especially as my boyfriend is 6"3! Although the staff were friendly no-one offered to help with bags and we had 2 flights of stairs to carry them up! Bed was not a double but in fact two singles pushed together which was extremely irritating as they kept pushing apart in the night meaning we were slipping down the middle :( Boyfriend noticed that curtains were so dirty they look like they've never been washed and shower panel was loose as well furniture out of date and well worn. The one massive negative I found which really let me down was the free inclusive breakfast I had read reviews that it was not to be missed and well worth it but on the Tuesday morning when we got up especially for breakfast I was left grumbling with hunger! It was literally bread, a slice of cheese (that looked like it had been left out for a good few hours if not a day!) and a piece of ham! Boyfriend commented on the fact the hardboiled eggs were particularly hard and not very nice. I also found the experience quite awkward as the whole time we were "eating" the staff were stood just staring at us waiting for us to finish, needless to say we never got up for breakfast again which did result in ultimately more euros being spent on food! :( With every negative there are positives and the ones I found were the bed (although two singles pushed together) were quite comfortable, the shower was very good and the location was its ultimate incentive for staying! its central to literally everything and the tram is right on your doorstep and when you've had a good night out there isn't too far to stumble :P For what it is I would describe it as overpriced and it is quite noisy and most disgusting of all is in 5 days our sheets were never changed even though a woman was coming in everyday bringing fresh towels and making the bed so surely common sense and hygiene would mean changing the sheets?? :S If your only after somewhere to keep your head down and have a shower this is your kind of hotel but it is pricey but for us as first timers in Amsterdam it was adequate just next time we'll research more throughly and maybe reach out further into Amsterdam to get good quality over location.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO!!!!”
Reviews.Author: georgia093
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not suitable for humans... on the first day we made a list of the things that were wrong with the hotel which came to two pages long. the wall paper was damp and hanging off, there were flies constantly in the room. we were told we would have a DVD player which we didnt, we had a small television with no remote and had to pay for the safe and the alarm clock every day even if you only wanted it for one day. there beds were broken and being held up by wood. the staff were extremely rude and spoke about us in dutch so we were unable to understand, and we were not allowed to take the key out of the hotel which we thought was unusual. the lights were broken and the toielt was leaking. the little things were adding up like the plug not fitting the sink in the worlds smallest bathroom, the curtains not fittin the windows and the staff drilling early hours of the morning the cleanere came once the whole holiday and then we were moaned at for putting our damp smelling towls and overflowing bin on the corridoor. the only good thing about this hotel was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very excellent place, but.....”
Reviews.Author: PavkaR
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is absolutly perfect. Walking distance from all of interesting places at Amsterdam.10 mins. by walk from Amsterdam Central station. Perfect location for shopping. But, hotels pictures on internet on a official hotel website are very different from reality! Room is very basic, bed is very old, but most horrible was bathroom! So small, so thin and dirty. Personal at this hotel is very friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was one from most horrible at our ways. One type of cheese, jam, butter, ham, tea and cofee and very small portion. It was all! But nice view from vindow to the canal at breakfast time...:-) I had been at Amsterdam 4 time before, we were at hotel Ibis Central Station, NH City centre and Bastion, it was about 30 Eur per night more than Ajax, only, but very, very better! For students,why not, may it be, but for me and my family, Ajax never more.....!

Reviews.Title: “A bunch of crybaby reviewers here”
Reviews.Author: pdxgwail0
Reviews.Content: This hotel was as advertised, not sure what the travelers who complain are used to - ritzy restaurants in hotsy totsy hotels? If you want a convenient central location, and very friendly staff, despite the limitations caused by being a low budget small hotel, this is the place. We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nite stay, found the people most gracious and helpful, and the only 'negative' for us, as some people pointed out, the stairs can be difficult to navigate, especially after one enjoys Amsterdam's many 'pleasures.' I'd stay there again. It is what it is. No more, no less.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE DONT DO IT!!”
Reviews.Author: elenoire1984
Reviews.Content: a triple room was a double room with an extra mattress on the floor,the size of the room was about was extremely small,the bathroom was almost dirty, they didnt change our sheets in 4days.there's no elevator so if you're at the last floor there's 3ramps of stairs incredibly steepy to go at room! the breakfast was for free but poor. and people smoke so much in the rooms that the fire alarm is often on!!the first time i had almost an heart attack for the fear!! just the position was pretty good.THAT PLACE IS A CRAP!edont throw away your money.its better spend 10 or 20 euros more and find somewhere alse!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Eve1969
Reviews.Content: Booked this as the website pictures looked great. All we needed was a bed for the night but were looking for somewhere central that was clean and friendly. How shocked were we when the 6 of us got into our rooms. the pictures on the web must have been from another hotel. this was the worst place I have ever stayed and wished for a Travelodge room. We paid a lot of money for the room but it was damp, covered in mould, wallpaper was peeling off the ceiling and we could only siot on the toilet with the door open. Luckily we managed to see the fun side of things but we got very well acquainted by the end of our 4 day stay. Bedding leaves a lot to be desired and the cleaners insisted on doing the cleaning and laundry at 5am; not great after we'd stumbled in at 4:30am. One to avoid if staying, research on Trip Advisor before booking as we will on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful”
Reviews.Author: Skinny_Fred
Reviews.Content: Tiny tiny rooms, very strong smell in the bathroom which btw was so small I could not use the shower (I'm 6"4...). the bed linen looked as they were from the 70's, very worn and disgusting. Did I mention the dead flies and bugs on the walls? The whole hotel is very run down and in very bad shape. Staff was the least service minded people I have ever met not to mention the manager David, who simply REFUSED to help us with our issues. All staff we met showed a very bad attitude towards guests. This hotel is simply as huge rip off!!! We found a nice 3 star hotel with very nice and clean room for less money than Ajax charged us, so have a proper look around before booking Ajax! There are much better options in the same area...

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the pictures!”
Reviews.Author: Snoopdoug1976
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest about this hotel. Location is spot on, a few minutes walk from Dam Square but the hotel itself was nothing to be impressed about! I suppose you should pay attention (which I didn't) when booking to notice that it is a 2* hotel and therefore does not need to be a certain standard, but for 100 Euros per night I would have expected much better. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful but we were given a room on the same level as the reception and their office appeared to be next door to our room. The staff were constantly in and out of this room and slamming doors no matter the time. The view from the room was out to a wall from the building next to us, so nothing to see! Shower had mould on the ceiling and the room was in need of some serious modernisation. You definitely paid for location rather than quality of hotel in this case.

Reviews.Title: “warning do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: yenatthebridge2011
Reviews.Content: I had to wait to write this review because I was so upset that I was afraid my review would seem more like the ranting and ravings of a mad woman then a review that would warn travelers about this awful hotel. First of all the tram is just outside your window and you are right on one of the busiest streets downtown. Location is the only plus on this hotel, The bed linen looked like it may have been washed a few weeks ago, there was a dead fly on the wall that looked like it had been there for some time because we couldn't even scrape it off, the bathroom well... lets just say neither of us showered in there. Not to mention the room was a shoebox, price ticket will kill you the average cost per night for three nights was 144 Euro a night the first night costing 242 Euro. When we complained the next day the hotel manger his name was David "If you want to leave you leave but I don't have to help you." We slept in the clothes we traveled in because it was late at night in the morning we let them keep our 432 Euro and checked into the nh the following day. It was quite an expensive lesson, one I would not wish to anyone. The hotel does not even resemble the pictures (and i have gone backpacking so i have stayed in some dumpy places), the staff are non-existent, and the treatment of guests is the worst I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice, but.............”
Reviews.Author: apollo_atlas
Reviews.Content: Hi to All, i would like to inform you, if you are planning to stray at Ajax hotel that is at center of the old town and you can find everything you like (coffeeshops, pubs, clubs, etc....)within few minutes. However the rooms are very small and is very expensive for what they offer. In general it is a good idea if you want something very close to the old town. I didn't like it when on Saturday evening, the fire alarm started and the receptionist of the hotel, came and knocked the door in a very rude way and asked me if we are smoking in the room. Of course we are smoking in the room. We asked for a smoking room and at the end we are in Amsterdam........

Reviews.Title: “The Tourist Trap!”
Reviews.Author: Nusle24
Reviews.Content: No value for money at all. Very small room, very dirty, mouldy walls, window less than one meter from at brick wall full of left overs from pigions. Window couldnt stay open one itself. Noise and smoke (hash) smell from the other rooms. Stayed five days, one day of "cleaning" = new towels, but cleaning or taking the garbage out. The bath was new but small, so at least that worked okay. Breakfast extremely poor with dry or soft bread directly from the bag, ane one cheese and ham and som boiled eggs. There would not be replaced new food unless asked for. Location good and easy directly to the tram. Location not romantic setting but pratical. But please choose another "hotel" a little fyther from the turist center and get the breakfast on a nearby cafe instead. cant recommend the "hotel" ot even seen though a money perspective. Too overpriced and bad or less service.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: racheljillian86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while travelling to Europe for the first time w. my brother back in 2005. I felt like I was time travelling when I arrived at this hotel (one of which my mom found randomly & suggested I book) .. Already anxiety-ridden from the long flight from LAX & the taxi ride from Schipol (I think my life flashed before my eyes), this was the first place we arrived at. Our experience was very similar to one of the previous reviews .. although most of what is said about this hotel was true, it was more humorous to us than anything, & overall we didn't have a terrible stay. Things to note (already been said before): *Narrow staircase (was trippy) *You have to be buzzed into the hotel after 10PM *We had an alright experience w. the staff. They were more than willing to help us find stuff to do. *Price wasn't that reasonable, but understandable I guess given location & season *My favorite part: going downstairs @ midnight to by a "Coke Light" from the receptionist, who was sleeping across three lobby chairs w. a little blanket ! *My mom called the hotel to talk to me, prompting the receptionist to run up three flights of stairs to bang on the door w. the cordless phone in her hand =) The room: small beds, looks like the kind of place someone might off themselves in .. otherwise, liveable --- but the view is a brick wall thru metal bars; the bathroom door hit the TV, & you have to sit on the toilet sideways. The view from the lobby, however is quite nice. Also, a pigeon went on & on for awhile, & we thought it was the people next door having sex. Oooops. We didn't encounter any bugs or unsightly grime .. that I can remember .. Continental breakfast is alright if you're broke. Nothing special. All in all this hotel gave me something to talk about when I went home. I would most likely try another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK room”
Reviews.Author: marinkau
Reviews.Content: The hotel may not be great, but it is satisfactory for it's price. We stayed in Amsterdam for a week in hotel Ajax and paid about 80 euros a day. The location of the hotel couldn't be better - It is exactly in the middle of everything (about 20 minute walk to the Van Gogh museum, which is the furthest away). The room is very small but was enough for us (as we didn't go all the way to Amsterdam to sit in our room all day...). The beds are separate and pulled together (not quite so successfully...), the bathroom is new - hot water availiable at all times. Had some trouble with the heating but the manager fixed it as soon as we said something - the staff is very very nice - some of them are quite clueless (the night shift people) but the manager and his dughter (there in the mornings) are wonderful. The rooms don't actually have a safe (or some of them do - like our room - but the safes work on batteries that tend to fall out or get stuck or something, and the manager soesn't have the spare key...). Kinda bothered me at first but we had NO trouble with our stuff. The room has no minibar of fridge (which bothered me quite a lot more). No free wifi - costs 8 euros a day (way too much...)/ In conclusion - may not be the best hotel, but definatly worth the money we paid for it!

Reviews.Title: “God Awful...”
Reviews.Author: rhyd78
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine booked this hotel for one night before having a look at Trip Adviser - a mistake. A horrible, horrible "hotel". We arrived at 3:35pm only to be told our rooms were being "cleaned" and would not be ready for another 30 minutes - not a good start. The room, even after "cleaning" was filthy, mattresses were brown and the (tiny) bathroom a biological hazard; on top of it all my friend awoke the next day to find he had been bitten several times. I was also on my own in thye hotel for a few hours as my friends had gone to the U2 concert and was pretty sure that someone was out in the corridors trying all the rooms to see if they were open. Incredibly dodgy, horrifically dirty - keep away.

Reviews.Title: “The most disguisting place I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Aggie999
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this place and learn from our experience. We stayed there for 3 nights, simply disguisting. When our toilet got broken and did not flush properly (we had to use a dustbin with a water from the shower to flush the toilet) nobody did fix it, we were only told to oups sorry, but there is nothing we can do. Breakfast - on Sunday morning, at 8:00am they ran out of bread. And this horrible smell everywhere, this place hasn't seen any cleaning for a decade or so. Do yourself a favour and stay away as you will not enjoy Amsterday the way you want. The city is great provided you don't stay in Ajax hote.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: formuladick
Reviews.Content: An absolute disgrace. I wish I had known about this website before booking! Things were bad from the outset. Very awkward access upto the first floor reception. We had to pay for the 2 nights even before getting a key. Then we get the key to a "cleaned" room that look as as though the previous tenants were still in there. We changed rooms to find a tidied room - but disgusting. Thick hair/dust around the sides of the room, mould and grime in the "private shower room". I would not wash my dog in there! Went back to reception to cancel my booking but "due to terms and conditions" he would only refund one night. I wasn't happy but I couldn't spend my wedding anniversary there. Be warned though. Although I paid electronically, the refund was via the old swipe paper slip etc. And guess what it wasn't then presented to the bank. It took 3 months to even get back half the money. Absolutely disgusting. Do Not go there

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: PatrickBSwindon_UK
Reviews.Content: I arrived to find they had taken my booking but had no rooms. They sent me to another disgusting 'hotel' miles away which was completely uninhabitable. The owner was completely unhelpful and I had to find my own accomodation in central Amsterdam at 10.00 pm after a long day of work/travel. The owner refused to refund my credit card and got abusive - I had to pay twice for that nights accomodation. On no account use this rip-off merchant.

Reviews.Title: “not recomended at all”
Reviews.Author: Maria013
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very well located ! this is the only positive thing ! but i dont recomend it at all: the hotel have small and unclean rooms, (a small peace of glass on the wc floor) the curtains and sheets have holes, and my belongs were mixed. A friend who traveled with me have her skin with bites of an unknowed bug. not recomended at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “No!!”
Reviews.Author: siorghraIreland
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the many negative comments about this hotel. I didn't mind the steep stairs, even though I had to go down them sideways as i have size 14 feet. Its Amsterdam and its is to be expected. We booked a 'triple room' and felt like sardines. There was no air-conditioning and had to leave the window open to breathe at night, which meant that the bulding work woke us up early every morning and kept us awake (not good when you are going to bed at 4AM). I found it impossible to use the toilet. I am well over 6 foot, but even my average height friends had to try and go sideways. It was crusted brown and the shower was mildewed. Every night I was attacked by wee beasties. There were 3 types of the buggers. On the first night, I killed about 20 small woodlice type things and a couple of small spider things. They were in my bed, on my pillows and I am home with bites all over my body. As I said, I killed a load on the first night and the blood was all over my bedsheet, which was not changed for the duration of my stay!! The maid did not change the disgusting sheets for 4 days!! Unbelievable!! Reception staff were not the friendliest, but if I worked there, I am sure I would not be too happy listening to complaints all day. Just a last comment before I go. Every night when we came back, our room light was on. We made sure we turned it off before we left, so staff were in our rooms every night. On the last night we came back and our aftershaves were missing. There are better places to stay for the same price and for a little more, you can have some comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gib-bolondon
Reviews.Content: Take the advice of the other reviews on here...AVOID at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “At Your Peril.”
Reviews.Author: Ant212
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in third world countries, and had better accomodation than this. I won't bore people describing the rooms, as this has been covered in previous reviews, very well I might add. The one incident I would like to mention, involved two of our friends. They came back to the Hotel late afternoon on the second day, to find their room door wide open, and all there belongings gone! The person in reception told them that they were due to check out that morning, and had not done so, so they did it for them. Their bags were under the table in reception. When they checked them, they found all their toilettries, and smellies were missing. After some conversation between staff the missing items were returned in a large polythene bag, no explanation was offered, as to why they had been removed. We were not due to check out until the following day anyway!! We also found out that staff members have access to the code that opens the room safes, you get a key! Obviously there has to be a question mark over the security in this hotel, as well as the cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying at Hotel Ajax”
Reviews.Author: MTpeanut
Reviews.Content: This was the first place I stayed at when I traveled from America to the Netherlands for the first time. I was glad I secured lodging at this hotel while staying in Amsterdam. Plan ahead, because Amsterdam is a hot-spot for people to come to. Since I traveled in July, vacancy was almost non-existent everywhere I looked. This hotel is very, very accessible to the tram system because it's on Rokin downtown. My friend and I arrived in short time from the Central train station and found the hotel with no trouble. At the time, the Euro was 1.37 to 1 US Dollar. The cost of the room was about 150 Euro per night and a 2 night minimum was required. This hotel is situated upstairs from the shop below. When they say "Dutch staircase" they mean it. It's a small staircase that ascends straight up; I'm not joking, straight up. So, lugging big bags will take some strength. Once you are inside, the owner and staff are very nice and casual and love to chat you up and tell you where to go. The main office serves as the common room and the breakfast room. This room has a nice view of the downtown area. At the time, there was a lot of construction going on right across the street. My friend and I rented a small room with a double bed and bathroom. The rooms are small and compact. Don't expect to lay out your stuff. The bed is in the center of the room with nightstands on either side. The bathroom is also compact and reminded me of an RV bathroom. There was a peculiar mold smell in our bathroom and a pigeon serenaded us in the hollowed out once-was-a-bathroom-vent space outside. The bed was comfortable and a TV is attached to the wall. There was even American shows and movies on their stations. Overall, our room was clean. The staff came everyday to make the bed and put out a fresh bath towel. Remember this: having towels of any kind in Europe is a luxury, so bring at least a face cloth and a bath towel, because some hotels do not even supply them for you. The hotel was very secure. They had security cameras down the halls and at the Dutch staircase. The room doors had to be unlocked with keys and relocked from the side you were on. The staff also holds your keys when you leave the building, so you don't lose them. On our stay, it was also very quiet. The noises you heard were the dinging of the tram system outside and the passerby people. Breakfast was included in the price of our room. It consisted of two kinds of cereal, breads and jams, hard-boiled eggs, sliced cheese, assortment of sliced hams, tea, coffee, milk, and juice. Light by American standard, but still good. Since this hotel is situated downtown, it's in prime location to everything. The locals walk and ride bikes, but you can get just about anywhere else from the tram. If you are extremely picky, don't stay here, but I'm pretty laid back and I would recommend this hotel to people I know traveling to Amsterdam; and I would personally stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “More a warning than a recommendation ...”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer085
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most ugly hotels I have ever been to! The room as well as the bathroom were small and dirty; the view is on a brick wall in 50 cm distance! Breakfast is not a lot (but coffee was fine - to say also something positive). The staff was with one exception not very friendly. All in all a very small value for the price - which is 125.- Euros pernight for a double room when you stay on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers meets Amityville”
Reviews.Author: SJP1978
Reviews.Content: The first thing that greets you when you arrive at the Ajax is a near-vertical flight of stairs. Not the most appealing of sights when you've lugged your bags off trains and trams from Schiphol, and if you have the misfortune of staying on the top floor- as we did- you have twice the climbing pleasure. Yes, buildings in Amsterdam are tall and narrow, blah blah blah, but tourists have suitcases, and the Ajax would do well to recognise that. The rooms themselves are, in a word, horrible. Even with the lowest of expectations, having read some of these reviews beforehand, I was still shocked. Only one of the lights in our room actually worked, and it wasn't the one in the tiny, cramped bathroom either. The rooms have neither air conditioning nor even simple air circulation, meaning that when temperatures were fresh outside, our room still felt like a sauna. This also means that if you like to apply make-up or style your hair in the morning, you may as well not bother; I had to give up and go au naturel for most of our stay. Only one of our three windows, covered with grubby net curtain, opened properly, and when it did, we were treated to the noise of building works on the street outside. The walls were dirty, and both the shower curtain and at least one of the towels provided were riddled with mould. I did bring along my own bathtowel, but this was promptly lifted by room service- presumably by mistake- and never returned. The icing on the cake was the surly night reception girl who made us stand for quarter of an hour one night waiting for our room key without acknowledging our presence while she dealt with an irate customer on the phone. (Evidently his client 'wasn't happy with his room' - no kidding) Suffice to say we didn't sample the all-inclusive breakfast. If this is the only hotel available during your stay then you might want to consider postponing your visit to Amsterdam. Seriously. Either that or head to the nearest bar or 'coffee shop' as soon as you arrive, and partake of their produce until you're too blitzed to care, and just grateful to have a place to rest your head.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: LeesaABQ
Reviews.Content: Dirty, dirty, dirty! Not safe, a couple was robbed in their room during my stay. Bathrooms completely covered in mold, could not step foot in the shower. Toilet and TV broken. Would never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: Adamo1Budapest
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel is really not so terrible as it was described. We stayed there, it was very pleasant. The staff was kind (probably they changed since the last comments), polite and helpful. The rooms are not too big, that is true, but they were clean, friendly. We got what we expected when we saw the photo of the rooms. And it is really in the center, as they say. We recommend to stay there. Amsterdam is not for staring at your walls in the hotel, it is for fun, guys!

Reviews.Title: “In the words of Bette Davis 'What a dump"”
Reviews.Author: se1johnb
Reviews.Content: If only we had known about this website before! I can only concur what most people have said the steep stairs surly and unhelpful staff at reception and then the rooms!! God help anyone who is stupid enough to book a room here after reading what people have said. The only positive note was there was constant hot water but the shower room was a disgrace. Mildewed walls pubic hair dubious brown stains in the toilet and we could not stand up as the ceiling sloped so much it was impossible to do so.No one mentioned when we booked that Rokin has been dug up to put in new tram lines and that they work until 02.00am with constant banging and noise of machines.The best thing we bought were ear plugs and if it wasnot for the fact that it was in a convenient spot and we had already paid we would have walked out.Avoid if at all possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst dump ever the Derry Bunch”
Reviews.Author: gabbyDerry
Reviews.Content: The only truth about the hotel on their web sight is that it is very central. Steep stairs lead to three floors were all rooms are dirty smelly ,furniture and fitting are all very shabby and broken. There was a party of 22 of us so I experienced many roooms. Breakfast if you could bring yourself to eat it was served in chipped and stained cups (stay clear) IF YOU WANT TO ENJOY AMSTERDAM DONT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “broken shower/bed”
Reviews.Author: WhiteRoseSpud
Reviews.Content: AVOID THIS HOTEL. PLEASE!!. Stayed here for 2 nights on a jolly with the lads. Arrived, then confronted with vertical staircases. Shared a triple room on third floor, room was a mess and one of the beds collapsed when my mate sat on it - we found it held together with electrical cable! Shower didnt work so we kindly bought a new shower head and repaired it. Tv mounted dangerously low on the wall - kept banging my head on it. Smallest toilet in the world - had to sit on it sideways as no room for my legs. Also dog ends in plantpots and dead pigeon on the window ledge. All in all cheap but extremely poor. Stay here at your peril!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Dump Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Johnas
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our honeymoon trip!!! What a joke! Totally the worst value for money I' ve ever paid in my life. We changed the initial room we had booked since it looked like a moist hell hole-cell; the window was just 10 inches away from the next building wall. There are no words to describe it. The walls were green from the fangae, the toilet/bathroom was smaller than a telephone booth and far more dirtier than anything we had ever seen. The next room we went was of the same style:dirty, noisy, smelly,destroyed etc. Pubic hair could be found around on the "floor". The windows did not close properly and the bed sheets were filled with holes.The stairs were too steep to climb with luggages, the breakfast was cheap and was served in the reception of the "hotel". We shouldnt have stayed there even if they gave it away for free....We paid approx. â‚¬100 per night!!! I felt like an idiot when i paid them. Bottom line: Dont be an idiot like us. NEVER EVER GO THERE!! Better sleep in the back of a garbage truck. God help you.

Reviews.Title: “What A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: Percyfilth
Reviews.Content: Saw the hotel on a web site and thought it looked ok. How wrong was i!!! It was cold, dirty, noisy and quite expensive too. The bathroom was freezing cold, the toilet had dried blood or poo on the seat. The bed clothes were dirty, we booked a double and got two single beds pushed together. The room hadnt been cleaned for god knows how long. The fire escape was blocked by an old bed and matress. The whole experience of Ajax hotel is one that we both want to forget about. I was disgusted with all of it and for the price i paid too. So if your thinking of stopping here, DONT DO IT! Iam far from a fussy bloke, but this was crap. Si from Notts.

Reviews.Title: “dont do it”
Reviews.Author: stevebas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Ajax for 4 nights changing to3 different rooms in that short time , but am sad to say each room was as bad as the last. Rooms were dirty and smelly , furniture was broken in every room we visited and in the first room we slept in the radiator was held to the wall with electrical wire at one end with the bed wedged up against the other end to keep it upright.The shower rooms in every room were of extremely poor quality built to the lowest cheapest standards possible with the wall so close to the toilet it was impossible to sit down without wedging your knees up against the wall in front.Breakfast was extremely basic and to be honest we went out to eat every morning rather than eat in such filthy surroundings.The sheets on the beds were the only clean thing in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: SEXISGOOD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location and is reasonably priced, but do not stay here if you want to ruin your trip. When you arrive you have to walk up stairs that are so steep, you almost have to climb up them. When you walk down them you have to walk sideways as the are so narrow. The reception is ok and the women working there are nice but the gentleman that ownes the hotel is very nasty and i would be suprised if he ever smiled or said hello to any of his customers. MOST IMPORTANTLY the rooms are discusting. The floor was dirty, there were stains on the walls and the bathroom was moldy a stunk. THIS HOTEL SHOULD BE DEMOLISHED!

Reviews.Title: “***AVOID*****”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Tom25
Reviews.Content: WARNING########AVOID AVOID AVOID######### This Hotel, should it even be called a hotel? Is THE worst hotel I have ever stayed in! I wouldnt care normally but it was expensive for what we got. From the outside it looks okay, theres a nice sign stating that it has two stars from the Amsterdam tourist board, although Hotel Ajax is no longer affliated with them. I know stairs in Amsterdam are tradiationally steep and narrow, thats fine. Things really start to get weird as you enter the reception/dining room/kitchen, and approach a member of staff. Not even a Hello? The guy wouldnt even look at us. So paid 160 euros for two nights for two of us in a 'double room' The walk up the other flights of stairs were uneventful apart from the full ash trays, the pink two tone paint seperated by a yet to be removed strip of masking tape, the seemingly random wires hanging from the ceiling? I wonder if they were live? Anyho onto the room, tucked away at the end of the corridor, a double bed with just enough room to stand around it, the shower and toilet tucked into seperate corners, whats that smell? A cupboard with no back showing the bare brick wall. The shower room is rank, mould up the walls, broken sink, broken shower head, the only thing that works is the mixer tap. Onto the water closet, not enough room to stand close to the toilet, maybe thats what the smell is? Out of the window the view is another brick wall. Apparantly breakfast was included in the price but we did not dare attend!!!!! In summary then: DO not, I repeat do not stay at this hotel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a quad room for four nights direct, via the WEB. Web site showed good photo of typical room, but an expensive price (but location was good). We thought that you only get what you pay for....how wrong we were.... When we arrived, the problems stated immediately. Ridiculously steep staircase. Room was dilapidated, dirty, had four single beds shoe-horned into what was obviously a twin room. Shower room / toilet was small, grotty. Fittings were hanging off the wall. When we complained, the Receptionist was very apologetic and helpful, saying that compaints were very common. We stayed for one night. When we told the Manager we were dissatified etc, he became abusive and told us to get out!! Which we did, and went to a much better, cleaner, friendlier hotel (Hotel Jupiter) for 50% less!! Please note that Hotel Ajax is no longer registered with the Amsterdam Tourist Office (VVV), who are well aware of the many shortcommings of the Ajax. Unless you are desperate, avoid this hotel like the plague.....come to think of it, if you do stay there, you may catch the plague!! This place is less than terrible - DON'T GO THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ajax H*ll on Earth”
Reviews.Author: ballard1955
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Ajax on a Friday night. My room was on the 3rd floor. The building has VERY steep stairs. Management was very attentive and kind. However, there were no other rooms available. My rooms shower was extremely mildewed and molded. The room reeked of the smell. The staff had the small window already opened. The next day, I bought a bottle of MR. MUSCLE Mildew remover, but it was not enough. All in all, it was a horrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beware with your reservations in this place! We were looking for a cheap and well-located place to spend one night in Amsterdam. We did the reservation (2 double rooms and 1 triple) and when we arrived...there werenÂ´t our rooms, so we had to stay into 1 five-people room and 1 double... and the owner wanted us to pay the same prize!!! Finally the hotel was really expensive (400â‚¬ for seven people, one night), and when I asked him for the room fares... he said that he didnÂ´t understand my English. So be careful if you go there because they are thieves!

Reviews.Title: “Live like a 16th century Amsterdammer!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unbeknowest to most tourists, there is a "theme hotel" located in Amsterdam and it is the Ajax Hotel. The staff I must add was receptive and welcoming but really it ends there. And another factor was the unusually warm weather in Amsterdam when I stayed there (31 C). But the excuses stop there. No elevator so I do not recommend those who cannot walk up steep flights of steps to stay there. The rooms (and I stayed in two) were clean but it seemed like not much was done to make the traveler comfortable (for reference see Jan Vermeer's "The Milkmaid" for a visual idea of the room I stayed in, not the one posted on the web site, that must have been one of the suites). No air conditioning or fan for that matter (see technological advances in the 17th century and see if you can find air comfort systems), the view I had the first night was of the tile rooftop and pigeons giving me a wake up call at 5:00 AM. Some paint peeling off the walls (again for reference see Dutch master paintings from the 1600s and observe the walls in the paintings). The other person who was with me had another room and had a view of a narrow alleyway where no one could walk through. The bathroom doubled as a sauna (with no intention to double as one). The shower head had a crack and water spewed in a spray at the shower curtain making water shoot out of the shower a bit. Now for the toilet, as far as I could tell they'll put one anywhere and when I tried to sit my 6'1" frame on the seat I could not put my legs where they "should be" in front of the toilet. For amusement I took clean pictures of that incident. The room and top floor for that matter appeared to have been in the process of falling apart (i.e. sheetrock walls crumbling where I did not see it earlier, the wire housings coming apart from the wall). Breakfast the next morning was fine, typical Dutch. The other room I was expecting more out of but was disappointed, the T.V. in that one didn't work and looked like it was made in the mid 1980s, someone before us who stayed in the room decided to place decals on the door, not very professional and family like, and again no air conditioning, a breeze sometines entered the room, we were in the gabled room and could see the gable hook from out the window. The website mentions a DVD player I did not know who had it, if they had more than one, or if you had to rent it for a fee, but I believe that's false advertising and I entered three rooms and did not see one. All in all, the people were nice but I would not recommend the hotel if you are going to take the wife or husband on a trip or if you are taking children. Definitely not worth the price of 119 Euros for a four person room, for that price in the states you could get a room with air conditioning, elevator, bar service, comfortable bathrooms and a decent view. Now I know why that milkmaid in Vermeer's painting looked so miserable in the room she was in. The hotel would be great for friends who do not look so much for the comforts of a hotel but a place to lay their heads down after going out all nights to the bars. My opinion only.

Reviews.Title: “Death Trap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well located but that is the single advantage of this place. Not especially cheap, bloody big flight of stairs to all rooms - most of which are miniscule. Window views out to a brick wall and pigeons in some rooms. Smoke detectors and fire alarms all, errrr, kind of hanging out of the walls. Probably a death trap as the exits are cramped. Breakfast not bad. Perhaps a tenner a night is nearer the mark, but bring your own smoke detector and ladder to be sure of leaving ok.

Reviews.Title: “A good Place to stay for a backpacker”
Reviews.Author: Sonia_Shen
Reviews.Content: It is a small hotel including breakfast. You can arrive there by tram or walking from Amsterdam Central Station. It won't take so long. Because it is close to the tram stop, you can hear noise made by the tram. However, by closing the windows, it won't be a problem. But if you need to carry a large baggage, then I don't sugget this hotel. That's because there is no elevator. By the way, the room is clean. So is the toilet. To sum up, I think it is a good place for a person with limited budget to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ajax
HotelInfo.Address: Rokin 104, Amsterdam 1012 KZ, The Netherlands
